alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 8:21PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain over much of the Death Valley National Park. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Shoshone, Texas Springs Campground, Death Valley Junction, Homewood Canyon-Valley Wells, Panamint Springs and Tecopa. Also includes Highways 190, 127 and 178. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
